revised_title: Gravity Wave Problems in the Motion of Perfect Liquids - Part III: Dispersion of a Fluid Column on a Rigid Horizontal Plane
tldr: This article investigates the dispersion of a fluid column under gravity, resting on a rigid horizontal plane. The authors develop a mathematical model for the problem, considering incompressible potential flow and neglecting viscosity, ground friction, and turbulence. They present numerical solutions for the early stages of the motion and discuss the implications for the collapse of fluid columns, such as the base surge observed during atomic weapon trials.
